intro: Ceratostema oyacachiensis, commonly known as the Andean starwort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant features small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a delicate touch to its rugged habitat. Its leaves are typically broad and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Ceratostema oyacachiensis is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows, where it plays a role in stabilizing the soil and supporting local biodiversity.
